To the chief Musician<S>5329</S>, A Psalm of David<S>1732</S>. In the LORD<S>3068</S> put I my trust<S>2620</S>: how say<S>559</S> ye to my soul<S>5315</S>, Flee<S>5110</S> as a bird<S>6833</S> to your mountain<S>2022</S>?
For, lo, the wicked<S>7563</S> bend<S>1869</S> their bow<S>7198</S>, they make ready<S>3559</S> their arrow<S>2671</S> upon the string<S>3499</S>, that they may privily<S>652</S> <S>1119</S> shoot<S>3384</S> at the upright<S>3477</S> in heart<S>3820</S>. <sup>privily: Heb. in darkness</sup>
If the foundations<S>8356</S> be destroyed<S>2040</S>, what can the righteous<S>6662</S> do<S>6466</S>?
The LORD<S>3068</S> is in his holy<S>6944</S> temple<S>1964</S>, the LORD'S<S>3068</S> throne<S>3678</S> is in heaven<S>8064</S>: his eyes<S>5869</S> behold<S>2372</S>, his eyelids<S>6079</S> try<S>974</S>, the children<S>1121</S> of men<S>120</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> trieth<S>974</S> the righteous<S>6662</S>: but the wicked<S>7563</S> and him that loveth<S>157</S> violence<S>2555</S> his soul<S>5315</S> hateth<S>8130</S>.
Upon the wicked<S>7563</S> he shall rain<S>4305</S> snares<S>6341</S>, fire<S>784</S> and brimstone<S>1614</S>, and an horrible<S>2152</S> tempest<S>7307</S>: this shall be the portion<S>4521</S> of their cup<S>3563</S>. <sup>an horrible: or, a burning tempest</sup>
For the righteous<S>6662</S> LORD<S>3068</S> loveth<S>157</S> righteousness<S>6666</S>; his countenance<S>6440</S> doth behold<S>2372</S> the upright<S>3477</S>.
